issue.title: action/runInAction are not untracked correctly when called within a computed.
issue.body:
<!--
  Thanks for filing an issue on MobX!

  Please make sure that you include the following information to ensure that your issue is actionable.

  If you don't follow the template, your issue may end up being closed without anyone looking at it carefully, because it is not actionable for us without the information in this template.
-->

**Intended outcome:**
The test case ["action in autorun does not keep / make computed values alive"](https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx/blob/main/packages/mobx/__tests__/v5/base/action.js#L350)  should prove that action is untracking correctly if ran within a computed, it's not.

<!--
What you were trying to accomplish when the bug occurred, and as much code as possible related to the source of the problem.
-->

**Actual outcome:**
The count is incorrectly 6 on [line 374](https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx/blob/main/packages/mobx/__tests__/v5/base/action.js#L374) when it should be 7. The value being 6 shows that the computed value is getting tracked (and cached). If the action was correctly untracking everything, calling the `callComputedTwice` function within an action should result in the call count incrementing by 2.

<!--
A description of what happened, including a screenshot or copy-paste of any related error messages, logs, or other output that might be related. Places to look for information include your browser console, server console, and network logs. Please avoid non-specific phrases like “didn’t work” or “broke”.
-->

**How to reproduce the issue:**

Replacing the call count on [line 374](https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx/blob/main/packages/mobx/__tests__/v5/base/action.js#L374) to 7 would be a correct. Then it's a matter of modifying code to make the test pass.

<!--
Please create a reproduction and link to it here. You can use the following starters:
- React: https://codesandbox.io/s/minimal-mobx-react-project-ppgml
- React Native: https://snack.expo.dev/vEF39Ohnb

If the issue is more complicated or not reproducible with React, feel free to create your CodeSandbox or your own GitHub repo with the code.

Instructions for how the issue can be reproduced by a maintainer or contributor. Be as specific as possible, and only mention what is necessary to reproduce the bug. If possible, try to isolate the exact circumstances in which the bug occurs and avoid speculation over what the cause might be. Help us so we can help you quickly.
-->

**Versions**
6.10.2

<!--
If you are unable to use CodeSandbox for whatever reasons, please list here all relevant dependencies

If you encounter the issue after upgrading from MobX 4/5 to MobX 6, make sure you've applied the migration guide: https://mobx.js.org/migrating-from-4-or-5.html
-->

comment.body:
Yes, this is a correct behavior. When you run in batch (action) there is a "temporal" tracking context, exactly so that computeds are cached for the duration of the batch.
I guess the test is about these last lines:
https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx/blob/13a222ea21bd55b7158d48a998846da608080ded/packages/mobx/__tests__/v5/base/action.js#L376C5-L377
Showing that once you dispose the outer the autorun, there aren't any lingering subscriptions.

comment.body: Perhaps this is as intended. I see some documentation showing the value should be cached if accessed multiple times within an action, and it appears correct in that the autorun isn't running more than it should (it's untracked). Looks like this can probably be closed.

issue.title: fix!: Prevent calling set on the return value of 'computed()'
issue.body:
BREAKING CHANGE: 'set()' method now only exists if a 'set()' is provided

<!--
    Thanks for taking the effort to create a PR! 🙌

    👋 Are you making a change to documentation only? Delete the rest of the template and go ahead.

    👋 If you are creating an extensive PR, you might want to open an issue with your idea first in case there is a chance for rejecting it.

-->

-   [x] Verified that there is no significant performance drop (`yarn mobx test:performance`)

issue.title: Mobx is not working with Draft.js
issue.body:
Hello! [Here is a sandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/modest-sun-htpyr5?file=/src/App.js):
Select all text in rich text editor and cut it (ctrl+a, ctrl+x). Everything will work as expected.
Now, comment the `App` component definition at line 39, and de-comment the `observer-App` component definition at line 56.
Try it again. Now it shows a strange error.
Any ideas what can cause the problem here?
My current workaround is using `key={random()}` on `Editor` component, so react will replace the node completely.

comment.body:
Seems like draftjs doesn't play well with `useSyncExternalStore`:
https://codesandbox.io/s/draftjs-useses-spg9ry

`Failed to execute 'removeChild' on 'Node': The node to be removed is not a child of this node.`
seems to be a known problem with `draftjs`:
https://github.com/facebookarchive/draft-js/issues/1320

issue.title: Mobx is not working with Draft.js

issue.body:
Hello! [Here is a sandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/modest-sun-htpyr5?file=/src/App.js):
Select all text in rich text editor and cut it (ctrl+a, ctrl+x). Everything will work as expected.

comment.body:
Sadly, it's not informative enough:
```
The above error occurred in the <DraftEditorLeaf> component:
    at DraftEditorLeaf (https://htpyr5.csb.app/node_modules/draft-js/lib/DraftEditorLeaf.react.js:50:35)
    at div
    at DraftEditorBlock (https://htpyr5.csb.app/node_modules/draft-js/lib/DraftEditorBlock.react.js:77:35)
    at div
    at div
    at DraftEditorContents (https://htpyr5.csb.app/node_modules/draft-js/lib/DraftEditorContents-core.react.js:70:29)
    at div
    at div
    at div
    at DraftEditor (https://htpyr5.csb.app/node_modules/draft-js/lib/DraftEditor.react.js:176:31)
    at _c (https://htpyr5.csb.app/node_modules/mobx-react-lite/es/observer.js:41:47)
Consider adding an error boundary to your tree to customize error handling behavior.
Visit https://reactjs.org/link/error-boundaries to learn more about error boundaries. 
    in Unknown
```

issue.title: docs: updated Canva logo
issue.body:
👋 This PR is a change to documentation only.
It introduces an updated [Canva](https://www.canva.com/) logo according to the latest Canva brand style.
Thank you!

comment.body: @mykola-rykov It seems like the entire deployment is not functioning, as my last documentation update has also not been deployed. We will try to find a solution and let you know once it is fixed. Thank you 👍

issue.title: docs: updated Canva logo
issue.body:
👋 This PR is a change to documentation only.
It introduces an updated [Canva](https://www.canva.com/) logo according to the latest Canva brand style.
Thank you!

comment.body:
Hi @kubk! There is one thing that can possibly not deploy automatically - in this PR I assumed that all static assets from `/docs/assets/*` are automatically uploaded & available at `https://mobx.js.org/assets/*`. Is that true? If not then can you please make the new `/docs/assets/canva.svg` asset available at `https://mobx.js.org/assets/canva.svg`?
Thank you again!

issue.title: Update Canva logo on homepage
issue.body:
Hi, this is Erik from Canva, one of the gold sponsors of MobX. We noticed that the homepage still displays our old logo. We updated it 2 years ago, so could you please replace it with the new one?
Here is a good-quality image of the new logo: https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1200/1*A6kkoOVJVpXPWewg8axc5w.png
Thanks!
